meanings.definition: Not taking sides in a conflict or disagreement.
meanings.sent1: She remained neutral during the argument between her friends.
meanings.sent2: The judge must be neutral and fair in all cases.
meanings.sent3: The cat took a neutral stance in the battle of the toys.
meanings.sent4: Her expression was as neutral as a blank sheet of paper.
meanings.sent5: Being neutral means staying out of the fight.

meanings.definition: Having no distinctive characteristics or qualities.
meanings.sent1: The room was painted in a neutral color.
meanings.sent2: His outfit was so neutral that it blended into the background.
meanings.sent3: The plain cake had a neutral taste that pleased everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her face was neutral, showing no emotion.
meanings.sent5: Neutral colors are calming and easy on the eyes.

meanings.definition: A position of gears in which no power is transmitted.
meanings.sent1: The car's transmission was in neutral, so it didn't move.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to put the bike in neutral before parking it.
meanings.sent3: The gears slipped into neutral unexpectedly, causing a delay.
meanings.sent4: The engine revved loudly when shifted from drive to neutral.
meanings.sent5: The neutral position is essential for a smooth gear change.
